titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid to the Classes of 1941-1950 records CA.MS.01016

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-10-24 15:40:13 -0400.

change.item: Finding aids for each class records were combined into this meta record, with additions from recent accessions

physdesc.extent: (22 record carton, 33 flat boxes, 35 archive letter boxes, 7 archive legal boxes, 23 archive half-letter boxes, 7 archive half-letter boxes)

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials in the Smith College Archives are open for use, with the following exceptions: "Office Files," files of records created for the use of the administrative unit that created them, are closed to research for a period of 10 years following their creation. Student academic records, student disciplinary records, and all records containing FERPA-covered student information are closed during the lifetime of the student. Student records created 100 years or more ago are assumed to be about deceased students. In all cases, the College Archives will continue to provide public access to materials that were intended to be public at the time of their creation (press releases, publications, etc.)

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: A portion of these materials were transferred to College Archives in 2007, 2008, 2010-2012, 2015-2017. Whenever donation information for a particular set of material is known, it is included in the finding aid below. However, a majority of the material was not formally accessioned and its origins are not currently known.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection brings together ten record groups that are arranged chronologically, one per graduating class. However, since some materials are placed in a class record group based on when they were created, and not by whom, materials relelvant to a class may exist in more than one series. 37 of the collection's 127 boxes are arranged in 15 accessions. 90 boxes have no accession number.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Classes have been archiving their historical material by year since 1879. Students from certain years of this particular class group, from 1941 to 1950, experienced collateral effects of World War II as they went about their days on campus.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Classes of 1941-1950 records, Box #, Smith College Archives, Northampton, Massachusetts.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Individual biographical files are also available, and often include photographs, photo albums, newspaper clippings, letters and correspondences, and class notes. These files, which are organized by class and are housed in the boxes numbered immnediately after each set of Class Records are not currently listed in any finding aid; contact Special Collections for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Classes of 1941-1950 records consist of individual class notes, examinations, papers and class letters, correspondence, photographs, scrapbooks, songbooks as well as reunion materials of the same nature.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Smith College retains copyright of materials created as part of its business operations; however, copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For instances which may regard materials in the collection not created by Smith College, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use. Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. All rights to this material are owned by the Smith College Archives.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Class of 1941 was the sixty-third graduating class of Smith College.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this record group: Class of 1941 records, Box #, Smith College Archives, Northampton, Massachusetts.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The Class of 1941 records were processed by Tiffany Tawzer in 2006.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this record group: Class of 1941 records, Box #, Smith College Archives, Northampton, Massachusetts.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Class of 1942 was the sixty-fourth graduating class of Smith College.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this record group: Class of 1942 records, Box #, Smith College Archives, Northampton, Massachusetts.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The Class of 1942 records were processed by Tiffany Tawzer in 2006.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Class of 1942 Records contain materials describing the history and activities of the Class of 1942, including materials from commencement, reunions, and other important events. Types of materials include photographs, invitations, songs, newspaper clippings, letters, questionnaires, and other memorabilia.
Individual biographical files are also available, and often include photographs, photo albums, newspaper clippings, letters and correspondences, and class notes.
Researchers must sign an access form to use the microfilm for the Class of 1942's 15th [1957] reunion questionnaires.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Researchers must sign an access form to use the microfilm for the Class of 1942's 15th [1957] reunion questionnaires.

did.unittitle: Class of 1942 materials, including letters, scrapbooks, and class records

physdesc.extent: (1 letter document box, 3 oversize flat boxes)

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Class of 1945 was the sixty-seventh graduating class of Smith College. As part of an accelerated war-time program, 100 students of the Class of 1945 graduated in August, 1944.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this record group: Class of 1945 records, Box #, Smith College Archives, Northampton, Massachusetts.

processinfo.head: Processing Information

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Class of 1945 Records contain materials describing the history and activities of the Class of 1945, including materials from commencement, reunions, and other important events. Types of materials include photographs, invitations, songs, newspaper clippings, programs, letters, memory books, and other memorabilia.
Individual biographical files are also available, and often include photographs, photo albums, newspaper clippings, letters and correspondences, and class notes.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Class of 1946 was the sixty-eighth graduating class of Smith College. As part of a war-time acceleration program, some members of the Class of 1946 graduated in August, 1945.
